Steps to reproduce:
* make sure there is only one perspective.
* open a c/c++-file in the editor, with the outline view.
* close the outline view
* open the outline view (Window - Show View - ...)
==> Outline view cannot be opened, an exception is thrown:

org.eclipse.core.runtime.AssertionFailedException: assertion failed: ContentViewer must have a content provider when input is set.
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Assert.isTrue(Assert.java:109)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.ContentViewer.setInput(ContentViewer.java:243)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.setInput(StructuredViewer.java:1606)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.ui.editor.CContentOutlinePage.setInput(CContentOutlinePage.java:519)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.ui.editor.CEditor.setOutlinePageInput(CEditor.java:1979)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.ui.editor.CEditor.getOutlinePage(CEditor.java:1220)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.ui.editor.CEditor.getAdapter(CEditor.java:1229)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.views.ViewsPlugin.getAdapter(ViewsPlugin.java:103)
	at org.eclipse.ui.views.contentoutline.ContentOutline.doCreatePage(ContentOutline.java:129)
...

The editor holds on to an instance of CContentOutlinePage when the Outline View is disposed. This object is reused when the view is opened again.
I made sure that reusing the page works, however it might be desirable to create a new instance of the CContentOutlinePage, 
Toni please review.
